description: Photos: A look at Ponce City Market
title: Photos: A look at Ponce City Market
title_page: Photos: A look at Ponce City Market
text:
1 / 12
Steve Schaefer The American flag flies over the renovated Ponce City Market in Atlanta. To read more about everything Ponce City Market has to offer, click here. STEVE SCHAEFER / SPECIAL TO THE AJC
2 / 12
Early afternoon shoppers walk through the Central Food Hall at Ponce City Market Sept. 17, 2015. STEVE SCHAEFER / SPECIAL TO THE AJC
3 / 12
A Farm To Ladle employee gets ready for the afternoon lunch rush at Ponce City Market. STEVE SCHAEFER / SPECIAL TO THE AJC
4 / 12
An original air and gas compressor sits in the lobby of Ponce City Market. STEVE SCHAEFER / SPECIAL TO THE AJC
5 / 12
Ashley Cox, left, and Chantel Taylor walk their bikes from Ponce City Market to the Atlanta Beltline for an afternoon ride Sept. 17, 2015. STEVE SCHAEFER / SPECIAL TO THE AJC
6 / 12
Marie Barker, a Ponce City Market guest service manager, sits at her desk Thursday, Sept. 17, 2015. Behind her desk are large electrical switches and other artifacts from the original Sears, Roebuck & Company building. STEVE SCHAEFER / SPECIAL TO THE AJC
7 / 12
Some of the original large steel beams can still be seen at the old Sears, Roebuck & Company building, now Ponce City Market. STEVE SCHAEFER / SPECIAL TO THE AJC
8 / 12
The newly renovated Ponce City Market in Atlanta offers a mix of living space, restaurants and retail shops. STEVE SCHAEFER / SPECIAL TO THE AJC
9 / 12
Steve Schaefer Rett Thompson, a resident at Ponce City Market in Atlanta, eats an early lunch in the Central Food Hall Thursday, Sept. 17, 2015. STEVE SCHAEFER / SPECIAL TO THE AJC
10 / 12
Steve Schaefer The American flag flies over the renovated Ponce City Market in Atlanta. STEVE SCHAEFER / SPECIAL TO THE AJC
11 / 12
Steve Schaefer The newly renovated Ponce City Market in Atlanta offers a mix of living space, restaurants and retail shops. STEVE SCHAEFER / SPECIAL TO THE AJC
12 / 12
